meanings.definition: Matter or substance in philosophy, especially as the material cause of all physical things.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the hyle to understand how things are made.
meanings.sent2: In philosophy class, we learned about hyle and its role in the world.
meanings.sent3: The hyle in the experiment seemed to have a mind of its own!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like hyle, shaping new ideas from nothing.
meanings.sent5: The hyle of the universe is a mysterious force that drives all creation.

meanings.definition: A resinous substance obtained from certain plants, used in varnishes and lacquers.
meanings.sent1: The artist applied hyle to the painting to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent2: The hyle used in the varnish came from a rare plant.
meanings.sent3: The hyle smelled so sweet, it was like painting with candy!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like hyle, adding a shiny coat to the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The hyle in the jar gleamed under the bright studio lights.
